parameters.name: algorithmSpecification
parameters.description: Definition of the Amazon Braket job to be created. Specifies the container image the job uses and information about the Python scripts used for entry and training. containerImage (dict) --- The container image used to create an Amazon Braket job. The URI locating the container image. scriptModeConfig (dict) --- Configures the paths to the Python scripts used for entry and training. compressionType (string) --- The type of compression used by the Python scripts for an Amazon Braket job. The path to the Python script that serves as the entry point for an Amazon Braket job. The URI that specifies the S3 path to the Python script module that contains the training script used by an Amazon Braket job.

nested_params.name: containerImage
nested_params.description: The container image used to create an Amazon Braket job.

nested_params.name: uri
nested_params.description: The URI locating the container image.

nested_params.name: scriptModeConfig
nested_params.description: Configures the paths to the Python scripts used for entry and training.

nested_params.name: compressionType
nested_params.description: The type of compression used by the Python scripts for an Amazon Braket job.

nested_params.name: entryPoint
nested_params.description: The path to the Python script that serves as the entry point for an Amazon Braket job.

nested_params.name: s3Uri
nested_params.description: The URI that specifies the S3 path to the Python script module that contains the training script used by an Amazon Braket job.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: The list of Amazon Braket resources associated with the hybrid job. (dict) --- The Amazon Braket resource and the association type. The Amazon Braket resource arn. The association type for the specified Amazon Braket resource arn.

nested_params.name: arn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Braket resource arn.

nested_params.name: type
nested_params.description: The association type for the specified Amazon Braket resource arn.

parameters.name: checkpointConfig
parameters.description: Information about the output locations for job checkpoint data. localPath (string) --- (Optional) The local directory where checkpoints are written. The default directory is /opt/braket/checkpoints/. Identifies the S3 path where you want Amazon Braket to store checkpoints. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

nested_params.name: localPath
nested_params.description: (Optional) The local directory where checkpoints are written. The default directory is /opt/braket/checkpoints/.

nested_params.name: s3Uri
nested_params.description: Identifies the S3 path where you want Amazon Braket to store checkpoints. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: A unique token that guarantees that the call to this API is idempotent. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: deviceConfig
parameters.description: The quantum processing unit (QPU) or simulator used to create an Amazon Braket job. The primary quantum processing unit (QPU) or simulator used to create and run an Amazon Braket job.

nested_params.name: device
nested_params.description: The primary quantum processing unit (QPU) or simulator used to create and run an Amazon Braket job.

parameters.name: hyperParameters
parameters.description: Algorithm-specific parameters used by an Amazon Braket job that influence the quality of the training job. The values are set with a string of JSON key:value pairs, where the key is the name of the hyperparameter and the value is the value of th hyperparameter. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: inputDataConfig
parameters.description: A list of parameters that specify the name and type of input data and where it is located. (dict) --- A list of parameters that specify the input channels, type of input data, and where it is located. A named input source that an Amazon Braket job can consume. contentType (string) --- The MIME type of the data. The location of the channel data. Information about the data stored in Amazon S3 used by the Amazon Braket job. Depending on the value specified for the S3DataType, identifies either a key name prefix or a manifest that locates the S3 data source.

nested_params.name: channelName
nested_params.description: A named input source that an Amazon Braket job can consume.

nested_params.name: contentType
nested_params.description: The MIME type of the data.

nested_params.name: dataSource
nested_params.description: The location of the channel data.

nested_params.name: s3DataSource
nested_params.description: Information about the data stored in Amazon S3 used by the Amazon Braket job.

nested_params.name: s3Uri
nested_params.description: Depending on the value specified for the S3DataType, identifies either a key name prefix or a manifest that locates the S3 data source.

parameters.name: instanceConfig
parameters.description: Configuration of the resource instances to use while running the hybrid job on Amazon Braket. instanceCount (integer) --- Configures the number of resource instances to use while running an Amazon Braket job on Amazon Braket. The default value is 1. Configures the type resource instances to use while running an Amazon Braket hybrid job. The size of the storage volume, in GB, that user wants to provision.

nested_params.name: instanceCount
nested_params.description: Configures the number of resource instances to use while running an Amazon Braket job on Amazon Braket. The default value is 1.

nested_params.name: instanceType
nested_params.description: Configures the type resource instances to use while running an Amazon Braket hybrid job.

nested_params.name: volumeSizeInGb
nested_params.description: The size of the storage volume, in GB, that user wants to provision.

parameters.name: jobName
parameters.description: The name of the Amazon Braket job.

parameters.name: outputDataConfig
parameters.description: The path to the S3 location where you want to store job artifacts and the encryption key used to store them. kmsKeyId (string) --- The AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that Amazon Braket uses to encrypt the job training artifacts at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Identifies the S3 path where you want Amazon Braket to store the job training artifacts. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

nested_params.name: kmsKeyId
nested_params.description: The AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that Amazon Braket uses to encrypt the job training artifacts at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption.

nested_params.name: s3Path
nested_params.description: Identifies the S3 path where you want Amazon Braket to store the job training artifacts. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

parameters.name: roleArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that Amazon Braket can assume to perform tasks on behalf of a user. It can access user resources, run an Amazon Braket job container on behalf of user, and output resources to the users' s3 buckets.

parameters.name: stoppingCondition
parameters.description: The user-defined criteria that specifies when a job stops running. maxRuntimeInSeconds (integer) --- The maximum length of time, in seconds, that an Amazon Braket job can run.

nested_params.name: maxRuntimeInSeconds
nested_params.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that an Amazon Braket job can run.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A tag object that consists of a key and an optional value, used to manage metadata for Amazon Braket resources. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.name: jobArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Amazon Braket job created.
